metadata.title: CVE-2020-27839 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in ceph-dashboard. The JSON Web Token (JWT) used for userauthentication is stored by the frontend application in the browserâ€™slocalStorage which is potentially vulnerable to attackers via XSS attacks.The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality andintegrity.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27839` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
ceph-base - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
ceph-common - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
ceph-fuse - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
ceph-grafana-dashboards - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
ceph-immutable-object-cache - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
ceph-mds - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
ceph-mgr - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
ceph-mgr-cephadm - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
ceph-mgr-dashboard - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
ceph-mgr-diskprediction-local - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
ceph-mgr-k8sevents - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
ceph-mgr-modules-core - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
ceph-mgr-rook - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
ceph-mon - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
ceph-osd - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
ceph-prometheus-alerts - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
ceph-resource-agents - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
cephadm - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
cephfs-shell - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
crimson-osd - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
libcephfs-java - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
libcephfs-jni - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
libcephfs2 - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
librados2 - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
libradosstriper1 - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
librbd1 - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
librgw2 - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
libsqlite3-mod-ceph - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
python3-ceph - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
python3-ceph-argparse - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
python3-ceph-common - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
python3-cephfs - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
python3-rados - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
python3-rbd - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2
python3-rgw - 16.1.0-0ubuntu2

No subscription required

criterions.comment: ceph package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '16.1.0-0ubuntu2').
